description: Number of riffle shuffles of 2n cards required to return the deck to initial state.
comments: Actually called overhand shuffle in the article. - _Michel Marcus_, Jun 22 2013
links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Steve M. Cohen and Paul R. Coe, Card shuffling in discrete mathematics, The College Mathematics Journal, Vol. 26, No. 3 (May, 1995), pp. 224-227.
formula: a(n) = 2*min(k) with k such that 4^k=1 mod(2n-1), see page 227 of article. - _Michel Marcus_, Jun 22 2013
mathematica: a[n_] := LCM[MultiplicativeOrder[2, 2n-1], 2]; Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 10 2015, adapted from PARI *)
